articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bereaved Family of Internationalist Nobichenko
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bereaved Family of Internationalist Nobichenko
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a wreath to the bereaved family of internationalist Ya. T. Nobichenko on the centenary of his birth. 
					 An event to lay the wreath before his grave and convey the warm greetings of Kim Jong Un to his bereaved family members took place at his home village of Travnoye in Dobolensk District, Novosibirsk Region of Russia on April 27. 
					
					 Present at the event were members of the bereaved family of Nobichenko, officials of the Novosibirsk Region and Dobolensk District, news reporters from capital and local areas, the delegation of the History Institute of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Vice Director Ri Sok Ryul, DPRK Ambassador to Russia Kim Yong Jae and officials of the DPRK embassy in Moscow and Korean officials in the construction field operational in Russia. 
					
					 The wreath sent by Kim Jong Un was laid before the grave of Nobichenko. 
					
					 The head of the DPRK delegation courteously conveyed the warm greetings sent by Kim Jong Un to the bereaved family members. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the event. 
					
					 The speakers expressed deep emotion at the warm revolutionary comradeship and noble obligation of internationalism of Kim Jong Un who is identical to Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and voiced boundless reverence for him. 
					
					 The bereaved family members of Nobichenko, moved to tears, said the late Nobichenko is immortal as an internationalist and a hero known worldwide thanks to the great leaders of the DPRK. They extended the deepest thanks to Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 At the end of the event the participants went round the grave of Nobichenko which was successfully remodeled thanks to the benevolence of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Congratulations to PM of Serbia
articles.content:
Congratulations to PM of Serbia
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Friday sent a congratulatory message to Aleksandar Vucic upon his appointment as prime minister of Serbia.
					 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and wished him success in his responsible work for the development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Ivica Dacic upon his appointment as first deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Serbia on the same day.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Youth League in Japan Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Youth League in Japan Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Korean Youth League in Japan headed by its Vice-Chairman Kim Tu Sop Sunday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the halls where Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, they made bows to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the Generalissimos received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The head of the delegation made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Songdowon International Children's Camp and January 8 Fishery Station of KPA
articles.content:
Senior State Officials Visit Songdowon International Children's Camp and January 8 Fishery Station of KPA
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Senior state officials Sunday visited the Songdowon International Children's Camp and the January 8 Fishery Station of the Korean People's Army.
					 They included Pak Pong Ju, Ro Tu Chol, Thae Jong Su, Vice Premiers Kim Yong Jin, Ri Mu Yong and Ri Chol Man, chief secretaries of provincial committees of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions.
					
					 They visited the camp where they laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute.
					
					 They went round various places of the camp which turned into a palace for children.
					
					 They were very impressed to see the campers buildings in modern style, the International Friendship Children's Hall, outdoor playground, gymnasium, indoor swimming pool and water park, aquarium, aviary, and other places where everything needed for the camp life of schoolchildren is in place.
					
					 The visitors went round the newly-built January 8 Fishery Station of the KPA.
					
					 From a ship they enjoyed a bird's eye view of the station, which has modern boats, freezing store, modern harbor facilities, and a dormitory for fishermen, houses and others.
					
					 They were greatly impressed to see the facilities for freezing and salting aquatic products and a conveyor for sorting and washing fishes, a flat-style freezer, refrigerator cars, the dormitory and a resting room.

articles.title: Premier Makes Field Survey of Water-way Project in S. Hwanghae Province
articles.content:
Premier Makes Field Survey of Water-way Project in S. Hwanghae Province
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the water-way project in South Hwanghae Province.
					 All officials and builders involved in the project are bringing about innovations in their all-out charge for completing the project as early as possible.
					
					 The premier learned about the project and held a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting called for carrying out assignments for all the stages of the construction without fail and accelerating its speed by giving full play to the mental power of the masses.
					
					 Steps were taken to ensure the quality of structures at the highest level and to satisfactorily provide raw and other materials needed for the project to relevant fields.
					
					 The premier also went round Haeju Trailing Farm Machine Factory and stressed the need to produce more high-efficiency farm machines by meticulously organizing technical management of equipment, and send them to farms.

articles.title: Ceremony for Completion of Workers' Hostel Held
articles.content:
Ceremony for Completion of Workers' Hostel Held
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- There appeared the splendid workers' hostel of Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill on the bank of picturesque River Taedong.
					 The hostel has three adjacent 7-storeyed buildings and communal service facilities including public bath, beauty parlor, shop, medical treatment room and library as well as a park where the boarders may have good rest and play amusement and sports games.
					
					 When visiting the mill in October last year, Marshal Kim Jong Un said that he would build a nice hostel as requested by leader Kim Jong Il. He personally set the site of the project, dispatched the powerful building forces of the Korean People's Army and solved all the matters arising in the project.
					
					 The ceremony for its completion was held on Saturday.
					
					 Present there were O Su Yong, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, An Jong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK, Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, officers and men of the KPA unit engaged in building the hostel and officials, labor innovators and employees of the mill.
					
					 Kim Su Gil, chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, made a report.
					
					 On the same day, workers of the mill moved to the hostel.
					
					 Officials concerned, officials and employees of the mill and the families of the boarders congratulated the boarders of the hostel, sharing joy with them.

articles.title: Acquittal of Those Charged with Attempted Rebellion Demanded
articles.content:
Acquittal of Those Charged with Attempted Rebellion Demanded
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Measure Committee to Denounce the Intelligence Service's Fabrication of Plotted Rebellion and Suppression under the Pretext of Security of south Korea held a press conference outside the Seoul High Court on April 29, according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Minbo. 
					 Speakers at the press conference said that there will be held the final hearing on an appeal for those related to the attempted rebellion case that day. 
					
					 They said the Intelligence Service (IS) fabricated the case to cover up the truth behind the "government" bodies' illegal interference in the election following its disclosure. 
					
					 It was also a fabrication to stamp out the progressive forces and check the movement for independent reunification, and a case to revive the most despicable "yusin" dictatorship which violates democracy and human rights, they noted, and went on:
					
					 It is none other than the criminal group IS to be punished for deceiving the people and abusing the law, and it is its Director Nam Jae Jun who should be detained. 
					
					 The speakers expressed the will to wage an unflinching struggle with all their efforts for the release of lawmaker Ri Sok Gi and others related to the case.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Condemned for Seeking Cooperation with Outsiders
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Condemned for Seeking Cooperation with Outsiders
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held the 146th meeting for peace and disarmament in front of the Defense Ministry on April 29 to denounce the puppet authorities for their frantic moves for confrontation with the fellow countrymen in collusion with outside forces. 
					 Speakers at the meeting said the chief executives of south Korea and the U.S. let loose foolish remarks to pressurize the north during their recent meeting. 
					
					 Pressed by the U.S., the authorities raised again the issue of concluding a military agreement with Japan which had been secretly pushed forward in the period of the Lee Myung Bak regime, the speakers said, and went on:
					
					 It is a mean plot to push forward the issue of concluding the agreement in the form of the memorandum of understanding in fear of provoking the anti-Japanese feelings of the people. 
					
					 If a military agreement with Japan is concluded, the south Korean army will be shackled to the "Self-Defense Forces" of Japan in such fields as information and operation only to back Japan's exercise of the "right to collective self-defense". 
					
					 South Korea should not conclude a military agreement with Japan which is trying to exercise the "right to collective self-defense", far from making an apology and reflection on its past crimes, they said, stressing they will never allow the conclusion of the agreement.

articles.title: Case of Tick Virus Infection Occur in S. Korea
articles.content:
Case of Tick Virus Infection Occur in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A person was infected with tick virus in South Chungchong Province on May 2, according to the south Korean MBC.
					 17 out of 36 infected were killed in south Korea last year.

articles.title: Chongryon Headquarters Vow to Glorify Congress with Pride of Victors
articles.content:
Chongryon Headquarters Vow to Glorify Congress with Pride of Victors
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A meeting of headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) took place in different parts of Japan to vow to glorify the 23rd Congress of Chongryon.
					 There took place in Tokyo, Japan on April 24 a meeting of officials and active members of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon to respond to the rally of officials and active members of Osaka Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon in which they vowed to wage as a general offensive the 70-day campaign for making the Congress a springboard for a great leaping progress to the fresh heyday of the glorious Kim Jong Un's era.
					
					 Present there were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, Hwang Myong, chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon, and other officials and active members.
					
					 Hwang Myong made a report.
					
					 He said he was greatly moved to take part in the rally in Osaka Prefectural Headquarters and to hear the appeal made by officials and active members reflecting their unshakable will, sincerity and conscience.
					
					 He called for making the Congress a springboard for a leaping progress for opening up a fresh heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan come what may.
					
					 Then followed speeches by Ryang Chun Sik, chairman of the Etogawa Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, and Jo Myong Jin, chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of the Korean Youth League in Japan.
					
					 Nam Sung U in his speech said officials and active members under the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon should wage the 70-day campaign as a general offensive with the firm will and resolution to implement the idea and intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He called for making redoubled efforts and attaining goals without fail and thus greet the Congress with the pride of victors.
					
					 Similar meetings took place in Kanagawa Prefectural Headquarters, Jiba Prefectural Headquarters and Aichi Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon on April 24 and 25.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Newspapers
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups illustrated with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and photos dealing with the immortal exploits of Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.
					 The Russian newspaper Komsomolskaya Pravda on April 15 dedicated a whole page to an article under the title of "President Kim Il Sung: believing in the people as in Heaven".
					
					 The paper elaborated on how Kim Il Sung illuminated the road to be taken by humankind with the bright sunny light and how ardently he loved people and embraced them with great attraction.
					
					 It edited facts that prominent figures of political and social circles of foreign countries praised the noble traits of the President and his exploits. 
					
					 The Zimbabwean newspaper Herald on the same day carried an article titled "Kim Il Sung: great exploits will be handed down through centuries". 
					
					 The Zambian paper Post on April 23 said the benevolent image of Kim Il Sung has been deeply cherished in the hearts of progressives. 
					
					 The Hungarian paper Liberation on April 18 said that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il devoted their all to the prosperity of the country and happiness of its people and that the service personnel and people of the DPRK are achieving proud successes in the building of a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Sun Marked by Paper of Koreans in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Day of Sun Marked by Paper of Koreans in Uzbekistan
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Thongil, newspaper of  Koreans in Uzbekistan, on April 24 carried a special article "Significant Day" on the occasion of Day of the Sun. 
					 The article said the DPRK grandly celebrated the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung, the eternal President of the DPRK. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Many foreign delegations and foreign and overseas Korean artistes who took part in the 29th April Spring Friendship Art Festival visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Mangyongdae is the historic land where Kim Il Sung was born and spent his childhood. Pyongyang was wrapped in celebration atmosphere in bright April days. 
					
					 Celebration meetings and gatherings took place across the country in celebration of Day of the Sun. Flags of the DPRK and the Workers' Party of Korea were hoisted in the streets of the capital and all other cities. The IAAF-27th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon took place with splendor in Pyongyang. In the evenings the beacon of the Tower of the Juche Idea erected in the excellent place on the bank of Taedong River shines brilliantly to lighten the world. 
					
					 The paper carried the news that the 21st Korean National Art Festival was held by Koreans in Uzbekistan in celebration of Day of the Sun and introduced the impressions of officials and compatriots of the General Association of Koreans in China after their visit to the homeland.
					
					 It also carried a photo-accompanied article "Delight and Optimism Full on Riding Course" introducing the Mirim Riding Club.

articles.title: Korean Organization in Germany Slams S. Korean Authorities' Sycophantic Treachery
articles.content:
Korean Organization in Germany Slams S. Korean Authorities' Sycophantic Treachery
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany posted on its internet website an article on April 24 denouncing the south Korean puppet authorities for their sycophantic treachery. 
					 The article said the south Korean authorities rejected the proposal of the north for a joint investigation into the drone case, but cried out for a joint investigation with the U.S. This is a far-fetched assertion of a traitor aiming at a joint investigation with the U.S., not with the fellow countrymen in the north, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The conscientious people of the world including intellectuals brand Park Geun Hye as an illegal "president", pointing an accusing finger at her. But she is shunning the south-north joint investigation though it will provide an opportunity for turning misfortune into blessings. 
					
					 South Korea's attitude of rejecting the north's proposal for joint investigation reminds one of the sinking of "Cheonan" warship. The truth behind the drone case is likely to be fabricated or modified just as what happened in the past. 
					
					 We bitterly denounce the reckless confrontational act of the sycophantic traitors kowtowing to the bloodsucker U.S., while distancing themselves from the compatriots.

articles.title: Polish Organization Protests against Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon
articles.content:
Polish Organization Protests against Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Polish branch of the Korean Friendship Association sent letters to the Foreign Ministry of Japan and the Japanese embassy in Warsaw on April 27 in protest against the Japanese authorities' suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					The organization has followed with deep concern the Japanese authorities' act to seize the Korean Hall of Chongryon and stamp out the movement of the Koreans in Japan, the letters said, and went on:
					
					We strongly denounce the Japanese authorities' act as an outrageous one seeking a sinister purpose.
					
					Koreans in Japan are victims to Japan's policy of colonial occupation of Korea, and their descendants.
					
					The Japanese imperialists illegally occupied Korea for more than four decades and imposed upon Koreans immeasurable sufferings.
					
					Although decades have passed since the defeat of Japanese imperialism, Japan has not yet made an apology or reparation for the crimes.
					
					More serious is that the Japanese authorities, quite contrary to the laws of Japan, usual practices of court and primary usages in proceedings of auctions, let the Tokyo District Court make an illegal decision on allowing the sale of the Korean Hall of Chongryon and has persistently resorted to crackdown on Koreans in Japan to attain their mean and wicked political purposes.
					
					We demand the Japanese authorities immediately stop such a fraud move of infringing upon the dignity and the right to existence of the Koreans in Japan.
